articles.description: Reaction to the weekend’s football, including Manchester City's draw at Liverpool, which ensured Arsenal remain top of the Premier League.
articles.title: Man City draw at Liverpool as Arsenal stay top - reaction

articles.description: Did Steve Borthwick produce his best win as England coach? Can Italy now avoid the Wooden Spoon? Is Le Garrec what France were missing?
articles.title: Six Nations talking points from round four

articles.description: After Liverpool's pulsating draw with Premier League title rivals Manchester City, Phil McNulty discusses five major talking points from the match.
articles.title: The hype is real - five Liverpool v Man City talking points

articles.description: MOTD2 pundit Danny Murphy explains the importance of Darwin Nunez and Virgil van Dijk in Liverpool's draw with Manchester City - and their title bid.
articles.title: ‘Monumental’ - how Nunez & Van Dijk make difference to Liverpool's title bid

articles.description: Manager Ange Postecoglou says Tottenham's fans can "get excited" as they thrash 10-man Aston Villa to raise hopes of qualifying for the Champions League.
articles.title: Spurs fans can 'get excited, why not?' - Postecoglou

articles.description: Anthony Davis enjoys a historic night as the Los Angeles Lakers record a 120-109 win against the Minnesota Timberwolves.
articles.title: NBA: Anthony Davis makes NBA history as Los Angeles Lakers beat Minnesota Timberwolves

articles.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp was bemused by the decision not to award his side a late penalty in the 1-1 Premier League draw with Manchester City.
articles.title: 'What must you have for lunch if you think that's not a penalty?'

articles.description: Josh van der Flier says Ireland are "mature enough" to "get ourselves right" in time to face Scotland after the 23-22 Six Nations defeat by England.
articles.title: 'Ireland mature enough to regroup for Scotland'

articles.description: Paris St-Germain are held to a 2-2 draw by Reims at the Parc des Princes as Kylian Mbappe starts on the bench.
articles.title: Mbappe dropped as PSG draw with Reims

articles.description: Serie A club Lecce sack manager Roberto D'Aversa after he headbutted Verona striker Thomas Henry following Sunday's 1-0 loss.
articles.title: Lecce sack manager D'Aversa for headbutting Henry
